Article Title: 'It could be, yes': Donald Trump says may visit India next year; calls PM Modi 'great friend'
Article Text:
File photo

‚ÄòTrump‚Äôs Team In Serious Discussions With India‚Äô: White House As India-US Trade Talks Continue

United States President Donald Trump on Thursday praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said he may travel to India next year as the two countries continue discussions on trade.Speaking to reporters at the White House after announcing a move to reduce the prices of weight loss drugs, Trump said his conversations with PM Modi were progressing smoothly. He also reiterated his personal rapport with the prime minister."He (PM Modi) largely stopped buying from Russia. And he is a friend of mine, and we speak. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is a great man. He is a friend of mine, and we speak and he wants me to go there. We will figure that out, I will go... Prime Minister Modi is a great man and I will be going," Trump said.When asked if he planned to visit India next year, Trump responded, "It could be, yes."The statement comes while trade talks continue between New Delhi and Washington after the United States imposed a 50 per cent tariff, including an additional 25 per cent duty, over India's purchase of Russian oil.Earlier on Tuesday, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said, "The President is positive and feels very strongly about the India-US relationship.A few weeks ago, he spoke to the Prime Minister directly when he celebrated Diwali in the Oval Office with many high-ranking Indian-American officials here at the White House."Her comments followed Trump‚Äôs recent claim that India reduced its import of Russian oil. During his Asia tour, he said New Delhi was "very good" on the issue and that Prime Minister Modi assured him India would reduce or stop crude imports from Moscow.Earlier this month, ministry of external affairs (MEA) issued a response to Trump's comments, reiterating that the country's energy sourcing decisions are based on national interests and consumer welfare.MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said, "India is a significant importer of oil and gas. It has been our consistent priority to safeguard the interests of the Indian consumer in a volatile energy scenario. Our import policies are guided entirely by this objective."
Article Summary: Us president donald trump praised prime minister narendra modi and said he may travel to india next year. Trump said his conversations with pm modi were progressing smoothly. The statement comes while trade talks continue between new delhi and washington after the united states imposed a 50 per cent tariff, including an additional 25 per cent duty.

Article Title: 2025 set to be second or third warmest year on record, driven by the highest ever atmospheric concentrations of GHG: WMO
Article Text:
AI-generate image

NEW DELHI: Year 2025 is set to be either the second or third warmest year on record as an alarming streak of exceptional temperatures continues, driven by record heat-trapping greenhouse gas (GHG) concentrations in the atmosphere, the World Meteorological Organisation (WMO) said on Thursday.So far, 2024 was the warmest year on record followed by 2023, the previous warmest. Both these years alongwith 2025 may, therefore, now be the three warmest years on record.Releasing its latest update on the state of global climate ahead of the annual UN climate summit (COP30) in Belem, Brazil, the global met body noted that the global mean near-surface temperature from Jan to Aug 2025 was 1.42 degree Celsius (¬± 0.12 degree C) above the pre-industrial (1850-1900) average, which was lower compared to 1.55 degree C (¬± 0.13 degree C) for the year 2024. The average temperature rise was 1.45 degree C in 2023.The update, based on six international datasets, showed that the 26-month period from June 2023 to Aug 2025 saw an extended streak of monthly record-breaking temperatures (apart from Feb 2025), and 2015 to 2025 will be the warmest 11 years on record in the 176-year observational history.Flagging record-high observed concentrations of the three key GHG in the atmosphere ‚Äì carbon dioxide, methane and nitrous oxide ‚Äì in 2024, the WMO said that the measurements to date from individual locations suggest that the levels of such concentrations will be even higher in 2025.‚ÄúThis unprecedented streak of high temperatures, combined with last year‚Äôs record increase in GHG levels, makes it clear that it will be virtually impossible to limit global warming to 1.5 degree C in the next few years without temporarily overshooting this target,‚Äù said WMO secretary-general Celeste Saulo.She, however, said the science is equally clear that it‚Äôs still entirely possible and essential to bring temperatures back down to 1.5 degree C by the end of the century ‚Äî the Paris Agreement‚Äôs goal of making efforts to limit global warming within that level.Though the year 2024 breached the Paris Agreement threshold of 1.5 degree c above pre-industrial (1850-1900) levels for the first time, one or more individual years exceeding 1.5 degree C does not necessarily mean that pursuing efforts to limit the temperature increase to 1.5 degree C is out of reach. Exceedance of warming levels, as referred to in the Paris deal, can be measured over an extended period, typically decades or longer.Referring to the average temperature rise in 2025, the WMO also flagged that the Arctic sea ice extent after the winter freeze was the lowest on record, Antarctic sea ice extent tracked well below average throughout the year, and long-term sea level rise trend continued.‚ÄúEach year above 1.5 degree C will hammer economies, deepen inequalities and inflict irreversible damage. We must act now, at great speed and scale, to make the overshoot as small, as short, and as safe as possible ‚Äì and bring temperatures back below 1.5 degree C before the end of the century,‚Äù said UN secretary-general Ant√≥nio Guterres.
Article Summary: So far, 2024 was the warmest year on record followed by 2023, the previous warmest. Both these years alongwith 2025 may, therefore, now be the three warmest years on record. The global mean near-surface temperature from jan to aug 2025 was 1.42 degree celsius.

Article Title: Antonio Brown net worth 2025: Inside the ex-Bucs receiver‚Äôs earnings, endorsements, and shocking financial decline
Article Text:
Antonio Brown net worth (AP Photos)

Antonio Brown‚Äôs Net Worth in 2025: From NFL millions to bankruptcy and legal trouble

More NFL News:

The name Antonio Brown once stood for brilliance on the football field, but today, it‚Äôs a symbol of a superstar‚Äôs dramatic fall from grace. The former NFL wide receiver, who dazzled fans with his unmatched speed and agility, is now facing serious legal trouble after being arrested for attempted homicide. Authorities confirmed that Brown, extradited from Dubai to Miami, is currently in custody over a May shooting incident outside a boxing event. It marks yet another dark turn in a career that has spiraled from record-breaking seasons to bankruptcy court.At his peak, Brown was among the most electrifying players in the NFL. With the Pittsburgh Steelers, he recorded multiple 1,000-yard seasons and earned seven Pro Bowl selections. His career earnings exceeded $80 million through lucrative contracts, but suspensions, fines, and abrupt team exits eroded much of that fortune. Once set to earn $30 million guaranteed with the Raiders, he ultimately collected only a fraction ‚Äî about $138,000 that year. His most productive years came with the Steelers, where he earned nearly $69 million and cemented his legacy as one of the league‚Äôs elite.According to Celebrity Net Worth, Antonio Brown‚Äôs net worth in 2025 stands at approximately -$3 million.In May 2024, the former Super Bowl champion filed for bankruptcy in Florida, declaring $50,000 in assets against roughly $3 million in debt. The filings, cited by multiple outlets, reveal that Brown owes money to former agents, marketing firms, and unpaid child support.However, one major asset remains untouched ‚Äî his $9 million Fort Lauderdale mansion. Purchased for $6.6 million in 2016, the luxury property is protected under Florida‚Äôs homestead law, which prevents a filer‚Äôs primary residence from being seized during bankruptcy proceedings.Brown‚Äôs post-football ventures, including a brief foray into rap music, failed to revive his financial standing. Legal disputes and unpaid obligations further compounded his problems. He‚Äôs faced lawsuits from promoters, allegations of unpaid wages, and a series of arrests that have overshadowed his athletic achievements.Now, at 37, the man who once stood at the pinnacle of professional sports finds himself battling criminal charges and mounting debts. Antonio Brown‚Äôs downfall serves as a sobering reminder of how quickly fame and fortune can vanish ‚Äî and how difficult it is to reclaim them once they‚Äôre gone.
Article Summary: Antonio brown, 37, is facing attempted homicide charges in miami. The former nfl wide receiver was arrested over a may shooting incident outside a boxing event. At his peak, brown was among the most electrifying players in the nfl. His career earnings exceeded $80 million through lucrative contracts.

Article Title: 'Insane and dangerous': Kash Patel's girlfriend supports Usha Vance amid anti-Hindu attack
Article Text:
FBI director Kash Patel's girlfriend condemned the vilification of Usha Vance amid the Hindu-Christian row.

JD Vance's Hindu Wife Usha To Convert After Vice President's Pitch? US Expert‚Äôs Big Reveal

From victim to villian









FBI director Kash Patel 's girlfriend Alexis Wilkins raised her voice in support of Second Lady Usha Vance amid a heightened scrutiny on Usha's religion, her relationship with the Vice President etc. The row started with JD Vance asserting that he hopes his wife converts to Christianity, but did not end with JD clarifying that he is well aware that Usha is not inclined to leave her Hindu faith and embrace Christianity. Usha Vance was slammed for not issuing any statement amid the row and instead appearing in public on the occasion of Halloween with her family.Democratic commentator Kaivan Shroff, in a blog, opined that while Usha Vance is being considered as a victim, in reality, she is not. Calling Vance the villain, Shroff wrote: "The second lady deserves to be held accountable for what she‚Äôs chosen to represent and the role she has willingly played in an admin whose values run counter to her very existence."Country music singer and political commentator Alexis Wilkin, who is also Kash Patel's girlfriend, reacted to the vilification of Usha Vance and condemned it, calling it 'insane and dangerous'.Wilkins also supported Democratic politician Ro Khanna who said that while JD Vance should be criticized for his policies, his family and children should not bear the brunt.Alexis herself faces a lot of trolling because of her relationship with FBI director Kash Patel as MAGA commentators call Alexis an Israeli spy who 'honeytrapped' Patel. Patel was at the center of a major row after former FBI agent Kyle Seraphin pointed out that Patel attended an event where Alexis performed on his government plane. Seraphin also claimed that Patel fired a senior FBI staff member who was in charge of aviation records after it got leaked, and also blocked public viewing of his flight data.Usha Vance was initially portrayed as a victim of MAGA politics as MAGA won't accept a non-Christian first lady. In his ambition to run for the presidency in 2028, JD Vance was distancing from his wife's Hindu religion -- this was the narrative, But within a few days, the narrative changed making Usha Vance the villain. Donald Trump's biographer Michael Wolff commented that JD Vance and Usha Vance are in it together and they are plotting every day to achieve the presidency.
Article Summary: Kash patel's girlfriend condemned the vilification of usha vance amid the hindu-christian row. The row started with jd vance asserting that he hopes his wife converts to christianity, but did not end with jd clarifying that he is not inclined to leave her hindu faith and embrace christianity.

Article Title: Donald Trump‚Äôs daughter-in-law Lara is looking to steal the spotlight from 2026 Super Bowl halftime headliner Bad Bunny at a rival event
Article Text:
(Image via Getty: Lara Trump and Bad Bunny)

Lara Trump wants to perform at Super Bowl rival event‚Äîjust to compete with 2026 halftime show headliner Bad Bunny

More coverage on Bad Bunny:

‚ÄúYou know what? You can throw Lara Trump in there. Yeah! That‚Äôs right,‚Äù said Lara Trump, US President Donald Trump ‚Äôs daughter-in-law, on her FOX Nation program Right View With Lara Trump in October. ‚ÄúImagine how upset people on the left would be if something like that happened. It sort of makes me want to offer myself up. I have not been asked, but I‚Äôm gonna offer it right now! Let‚Äôs see what happens.‚ÄùThe FOX News host openly said she would like to perform at a 2026 Super Bowl rival event, Turning Point USA‚Äôs upcoming ‚ÄúThe All-American Halftime Show.‚Äù Turning Point USA, a conservative youth organization founded by political activist Charlie Kirk, announced plans to host an alternative halftime show on February 8. The same day, 31-year-old Puerto Rican rapper Bad Bunny is set to headline the 2026 Super Bowl halftime show.In September 2024, Ron Filipkowski, Editor-in-Chief of MeidasTouch.com, unleashed a 19-second music video starring RNC Chair Lara Trump onto X, and the internet could not look away. The clip went viral, accumulating more than 7.2 million views in just over a year, along with thousands of comments, reposts, hearts, and bookmarks. Fast forward to October 2025, when the X account ‚ÄúCovie‚Äù reignited the frenzy by reposting the video with a shocking announcement: ‚ÄúBREAKING: Lara Trump will be performing her critically reviewed single to close the TPUSA Superbowl halftime show.‚Äù This time, the video soared past 11 million views in a month, sparking a fresh wave of reactions. A fan shared a photo of Jose Mourinho, the famous Portuguese football manager and former player, removing headphones with a frustrated look, captioned: ‚ÄúAnother win for the deaf.‚Äù Another fan posted a famous meme of a man leaving mid-shower to change a song, with the caption: ‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre mid shower with soap in your eyes but that Lara trump starts playing.‚Äù A third fan commented, ‚ÄúI‚Äôd rather listen to Bad Bunny and not be able to understand a word he‚Äôs saying over this üòÇ.‚ÄùA recent viral rumor on X under the name ‚ÄúTrump Tracker‚Äù claims, ‚ÄúTurning Point USA is considering cancelling their Super Bowl halftime show due to lack of interest, and being unable to obtain a right wing star large enough to draw a crowd.‚Äù Without an official announcement from Turning Point USA, these claims remain unverified.
Article Summary: Lara trump said she would like to perform at a 2026 super bowl rival event. Turning point usa, a conservative youth organization, announced plans to host an alternative halftime show on february 8. The same day, 31-year-old puerto rican rapper bad bunny is set to headline the super bowl halftime show.

Article Title: NHL Trade Rumor: Buffalo Sabres planning to trade for goaltender Alexander Georgiev amid goalie logjam
Article Text:
Alexandar Georgiev is planned to be traded by the Buffalo Sabres (Credit: Getty Images)

Are Buffalo Sabres planning to trade Alex Georgiev amid goalie logjam?

"It's A Really Good Group Of Guys" | Alexandar Georgiev Before Preseason vs CBJ | Buffalo Sabres

Also read

The Buffalo Sabres are currently dealing with a potentially problematic goalie logjam throughout the upper levels of the organization, which may force general manager Kevyn Adams to make an early trade. Therefore, reports are suggesting, according to hockey insider Elliotte Friedman, the Buffalo Sabres are actively exploring options to trade veteran goaltender Alexandar Georgiev.As of Georgiev‚Äôs performance, he has emerged as a promising goaltender in the league. Earlier, Georgiev was traded to the San Jose Sharks by the Colorado Avalanche on December 9, 2024, three seasons after he was acquired from the New York Rangers. However, after some years, he signed a one-year, $825,000 contract with the Buffalo Sabres on September 11, 2025, after playing for the Avalanche and San Jose Sharks. The Buffalo Sabres are reportedly shopping veteran goaltender Alexandar Georgiev , as revealed by NHL insider Elliotte Friedman. According to Friedman, the Sabres have initiated discussions with other teams, signaling their intent to move the former All-Star amid a crowded goaltending situation.He stated, ‚ÄúThe Sabres have made it clear Colten Ellis is staying. Someone asked me if Ukko-Pekka Luukkonen could be moved, but I'd be surprised. He's still their most-experienced and best option, assuming he is healthy."Later, he added, ‚ÄúThey are trying to find a new home for Alexandar Georgiev.‚Äù Friedman reported that Buffalo‚Äôs front office has been active in exploring potential trade scenarios.Meanwhile, Alex Lyon, who's seized the Sabres' No. 1 goalie job with a terrific start to the 2025-26 season, and prized prospect Devon Levi are the other goaltenders in the picture for Buffalo.Georgiev, 29, actually joined the Sabres as a short-term stabilizer, but his inconsistent play and his recent performances have been uneven this season. Once regarded as one of the NHL‚Äôs most reliable backups, his save percentage has dipped below .900 this season. That decline, coupled with Buffalo‚Äôs defensive inconsistencies, has hurt his market value.Although General Manager Kevyn Adams has not publicly commented on the situation, insiders suggest that trade talks could progress quickly, especially as the NHL season nears the midpoint and teams reassess their rosters ahead of the trade deadline.
Article Summary: The buffalo sabres are reportedly shopping veteran goaltender alexandar georgiev. The 29-year-old joined the sabres as a short-term stabilizer, but his inconsistent play and his recent performances have been uneven this season. According to nhl insider elliotte friedman, the sabres have initiated discussions with other teams, signaling their intent to move the former all-star.

Article Title: How many years could Antonio Brown face in prison after shocking attempted murder charge?
Article Text:
Antonio Brown extradited to the U.S. to face attempted murder charge (Getty Images)

How long could Super Bowl champ Antonio Brown serve if convicted of attempted murder?



More

NFL News

Former NFL superstar Antonio Brown has once again found himself in the center of a serious legal storm. The 37-year-old ex-wide receiver has been extradited from Dubai, United Arab Emirates, back to the United States to face an attempted murder charge in connection with a shooting that occurred outside a boxing event in South Florida earlier this year. According to the Miami Herald, Brown is expected to stand trial after a warrant was issued for his arrest in June.‚ÄúBrown‚Äôs Instagram posts show he has been in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, for the last few months. When the warrant was issued for the Miami native‚Äôs arrest in June, he had an attorney who secured him a $10,000 bond, including house arrest. But Brown never turned himself in.‚ÄùThe charges stem from a violent altercation in May during a celebrity boxing event hosted by streamer Adin Ross in Miami. Videos circulated online appearing to show Brown engaged in a heated confrontation with several people outside the venue. In one clip, the former Tampa Bay Buccaneers receiver was allegedly seen holding a black pistol and chasing someone before a gunshot rang out, sending bystanders fleeing.According to the arrest warrant obtained by The Washington Post, police reviewed surveillance footage showing Brown punching a man, which ‚Äúsparked a melee.‚ÄùThe report also stated that Brown allegedly took a gun from a security guard before running after the same individual. The victim was later identified as Zul-Qarnain Kwame Nantambu, who gained attention earlier this year for waving a Palestinian flag during Kendrick Lamar‚Äôs Super Bowl halftime performance.Authorities charged Brown with attempted second-degree murder with a firearm‚Äîa felony that could carry a maximum sentence of 15 years in prison and a $10,000 fine under Florida law. Legal experts note that while sentencing can vary based on intent and prior offenses, prosecutors may push for a tougher penalty given Brown‚Äôs history of legal troubles.The former NFL star‚Äôs career once glittered with achievements. During his prime with the Pittsburgh Steelers, Brown twice led the league in receptions and receiving yards. But his success was overshadowed by off-field controversies, including sexual misconduct lawsuits, battery charges, and multiple arrests.Now, Brown‚Äôs latest case could mark a defining moment in a tumultuous post-football life. If convicted on the top charge, the once-celebrated Super Bowl champion may spend more than a decade behind bars‚Äîan ending few could have imagined for one of the NFL‚Äôs most electrifying talents.
Article Summary: Antonio brown extradited to the u.s. to face attempted murder charge. Charges stem from a violent altercation in may during a celebrity boxing event in miami. If convicted on the top charge, the once-celebrated super bowl champion may spend more than a decade behind bars.

Article Title: Why did Kai Cenat‚Äôs girlfriend‚Äôs mom call him out online? The truth behind the viral video
Article Text:
Why did Kai Cenat‚Äôs girlfriend‚Äôs mom call him out online? The truth behind the viral video (Image via Getty)

Ashlee Monroe defends herself and calls out Kai Cenat





Twitch star Kai Cenat is caught in a new controversy after his girlfriend‚Äôs mother spoke out against him online. On November 5, 2025, Ashlee Monroe, mother of Kai‚Äôs girlfriend Gabrielle Alayah (also known as Gigi), posted an emotional video on Instagram. She reacted to her daughter‚Äôs old comments about growing up without love. Ashlee said she always cared for Gabrielle and called her daughter‚Äôs words hurtful and untrue.Things took a bigger turn when Ashlee claimed that Kai told Gabrielle to keep their family life off the internet. Ashlee said Kai warned Gabrielle that being seen with her mother could hurt her image. The video quickly went viral and brought huge attention to the streamer‚Äôs personal life. The comments sparked debate about Kai‚Äôs influence, Gabrielle‚Äôs family relationship, and how fame can affect personal bonds.Ashlee said Gabrielle‚Äôs words broke her heart. She said, ‚ÄúSeeing that video broke me‚Ä¶ To say you went through life feeling unloved is crazy! I was there! I haven‚Äôt missed anything in that kid‚Äôs life.‚Äù Ashlee said she has always been a caring mother and told Gabrielle, ‚ÄúNo matter what, baby, I love you.‚ÄùShe also said Gabrielle told her to stay off social media after Kai got involved. According to Ashlee, her daughter said, ‚ÄúI think we need to keep our relationship off the internet,‚Äù and added, ‚ÄúKai said‚Ä¶‚Äù Ashlee claimed Kai Cenat told Gabrielle he had ‚Äúdone his research‚Äù on her and that spending time with her mother could ‚Äúruin her reputation.‚Äù Ashlee said she couldn‚Äôt believe it and called it ‚Äúridiculous.‚ÄùIn her video, Ashlee also spoke about Kai‚Äôs online behavior. She said, ‚ÄúAll you do is sit down with women of different reputations‚Ä¶ all you do is sit down with rappers. You never thought to sit down over a glass of water with me?‚Äù Ashlee said Gabrielle has changed since being with Kai, adding, ‚ÄúEver since this has been going on, I don‚Äôt recognize her.‚ÄùThe Instagram video went viral on November 5, and fans began sharing clips across TikTok, X (Twitter), and YouTube, sparking conversations about Kai‚Äôs influence and Gabrielle‚Äôs family distance.Kai has not publicly answered Ashlee‚Äôs claims yet. However, fans recalled his earlier comments about his values. In 2023, Kai Cenat revealed he turned down a $60 million gambling deal, saying ‚Äúnot all money is good money.‚Äù He said he didn‚Äôt want to risk his focus or his morals for money.Also Read: Serena Williams Brings Wimbledon Vibes To The Spanish Royal Event And Alexis Ohanian‚Äôs Sweet Reaction Wins Hearts Earlier in October 2025, Kai and Gabrielle were seen giving an interview while on holiday in Switzerland after his record-breaking Mafiathon on Twitch, where he hit over one million active subscribers.But after Ashlee‚Äôs emotional post in early November, attention shifted from Kai Cenat‚Äôs achievements to his personal life. Many are now waiting for either Kai or Gabrielle to respond to the claims made by Ashlee on Instagram.
Article Summary: Ashlee monroe, mother of kai cenat's girlfriend gabrielle alayah (also known as gigi), posted an emotional video on instagram. She reacted to her daughter‚Äôs old comments about growing up without love. The video quickly went viral and brought huge attention to the streamer's personal life.

Article Title: Dak Prescott‚Äôs fianc√©e Sarah Jane Ramos mourns Cowboys‚Äô Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs death in emotional message that broke fans‚Äô hearts
Article Text:
Dak Prescott‚Äôs fianc√©e Sarah Jane Ramos

Dak Prescott‚Äôs fianc√©e urges compassion after Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs tragic death



Dak Prescott‚Äôs fianc√©e reacts to heartbreaking death of Marshawn Kneeland (Via Instagram)

More coverage on NFL:

The Dallas Cowboys community is mourning the heartbreaking loss of defensive end Marshawn Kneeland, who tragically died on Thursday morning at just 24 years old. The team confirmed the devastating news in an emotional statement shared on social media, sparking an overwhelming wave of grief and support from players, fans, and the wider NFL world. According to the Frisco Police Department, Kneeland‚Äôs death was ruled an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound, sending shockwaves through a league already familiar with the importance of mental health awareness.Among those deeply affected was Sarah Jane Ramos, the fianc√©e of Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott, who has long been an advocate for mental health following his own family tragedy. Ramos took to Instagram to express her sorrow, writing, ‚ÄúDevastating,‚Äù while reposting the Cowboys‚Äô official statement. She added, ‚ÄúPlease lift this family and community up with love and prayers. Rest in Peace, Marshawn.‚Äù Her words echoed the collective heartbreak felt across the Cowboys‚Äô locker room and beyond.The Cowboys‚Äô official statement read, ‚ÄúIt is with extreme sadness that the Dallas Cowboys share that Marshawn Kneeland tragically passed away this morning. Marshawn was a beloved teammate and member of our organization.Our thoughts and prayers regarding Marshawn are with his girlfriend Catalina and his family.‚ÄùPrescott, who lost his brother Jace to suicide in 2020, has spoken openly about his own mental health battles and the need for open conversations around emotional struggles. His foundation, Faith Fight Finish, continues to focus on mental health advocacy, reminding players and fans alike that even in professional sports, no one is immune to internal pain.Kneeland was known not just for his power on the field but for his warm personality and dedication to his team. Drafted in the second round of the 2024 NFL Draft from Western Michigan, he played in 18 games, recording 26 tackles, five for loss, and one sack. His career highlight came during Monday Night Football against the Arizona Cardinals when he scored his first touchdown by recovering a blocked punt in the end zone.Today, the Cowboys and the entire NFL community remember Marshawn Kneeland‚Äînot just as an athlete, but as a teammate, a friend, and a young man gone far too soon.
Article Summary: Marshawn kneeland, 24, died of an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound on thursday. The dallas cowboys confirmed the news in an emotional statement shared on social media. Among those deeply affected was sarah jane ramos, the fianc√©e of cowboys quarterback dak prescott.

Article Title: Sneako admires Zohran Mamdani and wife Rama Duwaji‚Äôs real love and the internet falls for their charm
Article Text: New York politician Zohran Mamdani and artist Rama Duwaji found love on Hinge in 2021, leading to a simple marriage in early 2025. A viral post by Sneako brought attention to their down-to-earth relationship, emphasizing that public figures can also have ordinary, real love lives.

Article Title: Nikki Haley's son calls Vivek Ramaswamy's lessons from Zohran Mamdani's winning 'cringe'
Article Text:
Nikki Haley's son Nalin Haley clashes with Vivek Ramaswamy, calls his takeaways from GOP poll defeats cringe.

NYC Mayoral: U.S. Democrat's SHOCK PREDICTION After Zohran Mamdani's Stunning Victory

End identity politics







At a time when Republican commentators are reflecting on whether the defeat in New York, New Jersey and Virginia was a result of the rise of hate comments targeting immigrants, especially Indians, Nikki Haley 's son Nalin Haley chose to target Indian-origin Vivek Ramaswamy and his takeaway from the three election defeats."We got our a**es handed to us. In New Jersey, Virginia and New York City. Democrats swept all three. There are two key lessons for Republicans. Listen carefully," Ramaswamy said in his takeaway video. "Number one: our side needs to focus on affordability. Make the American Dream affordable. Bring down costs, electric costs, grocery costs, healthcare costs and housing costs. And lay out how we're gonna do it," Ramaswamy said without naming New York's Zohran Mamdani or any other candidates."And number two, cut out the identity politics. It doesn't suit Republicans. It's not for us. That's the woke Left's game, not ours. We don't care about the color of your skin or your religion. We care about the content of your character. That's what who we are," the GOP leader said.Ramaswamy urged to end identity politics earlier, also when he was trolled for his Halloween celebration photo or when MAGA imploded over Second Lady Usha Vance's religion.Many commentators agreed with Ramaswamy and said that he hit the nail on the head and it took three defeats for MAGA to not leave a comment on Ramaswamy's skin color under the video; not everyone was on board.Nalin Haley, son of former South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley, who has emerged as a vocal MAGA commentator, chose to contradict with Ramaswamy and called his talking points outdated and cringeworthy. Nalin said the GOP can't do away with identity politics as the Republican Party cares about religion and Christians have every right to want to be represented by another Christian."Wrong again. We care about religion and Christians have every right to want to be represented by another Christian. The 2010‚Äôs talking points are so cringe bro," Nikki Haley's son wrote.
Article Summary: Nikki haley's son nalin haley clashes with vivek ramaswamy, calls his takeaways from gop poll defeats cringe. Nalin said the gop can't do away with identity politics as the republican party cares about religion and christians have every right to want to be represented by another christian.

Article Title: US Supreme Court skeptical of Trump tariffs
Article Text:
.

The TOI correspondent from Washington:

Donald Trump‚Äôs Trade Weapon Tested: US Supreme Court Weighs Limits of Emergency Powers, Authority





In a marathon 2¬Ω-hour session that exposed fissures in the Trump administration's trade agenda, the US Supreme Court on Wednesday grilled lawyers over Trump tariffs imposed under a 1977 emergency powers law, with even conservative justices expressing skepticism over presidential powers in the matter.Neal Katyal, the Indian-American litigator leading the case for small businesses, delivered a forceful defence of congressional primacy, earning praise from legal scholars even as justices from both ideological flanks voiced doubts about the policy's legality. The case, consolidated as Trump vs VOS Selections Inc. and Learning Resources, Inc. vs Trump, could redefine executive authority in an era of economic nationalism.President Trump has warned several times that the case is a ‚Äúmatter of life and death‚Äù for the US and if the court ruled against his powers to tariff, ‚Äúwe could end up being a third-world country.‚Äù Countries and businesses across the world, not to speak of American business and industry, are watching the case -- many in person -- given its enormous import on global trade and commerce.‚ÄúIf our country was not able to protect itself by using tariffs against tariffs, we would be ‚Äòdead,‚Äô with no chance of survival or success,‚Äù Trump said in one of several posts on the case which he once intended to attend personally but dropped the idea because it would be a distraction.Katyal, a Yale Law School alum with over 50 Supreme Court arguments under his belt, opened with a stark declaration before the court: "Tariffs are taxes," and only the Congress is constitutionally empowered to impose them. Representing importers like VOS Selections, a family-run wine and spirits firm, and educational toy makers battered by rates up to 145% on Chinese goods, he argued the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) authorises embargoes and quotas, not revenue-raising levies."The founders gave that taxing power to Congress alone," Katyal said, invoking Article I of the Constitution and the nondelegation doctrine. He dismissed the administration's claim that IEEPA's "regulate importation" clause covers tariffs as "fanciful," noting no president from Reagan to Obama had ever wielded it in that manner.The bench's reaction was a bipartisan fusillade, as it came down much harder on the government lawyer, solicitor general John Sauer, than on Katyal. Chief justice John Roberts, an institutionalist, zeroed in on IEEPA's silence on "tariff," observing Congress has spelled out such powers elsewhere. Justice Neil Gorsuch, a textualist skeptic of executive overreach, also pressed Sauer on a "one-way ratchet" where Congress couldn't reclaim authority, musing it "could swallow the Constitution. " Both Roberts and Gorsuch are conservatives in a 6-3 supermajority that Trump has engineered.Legal luminaries hailed Katyal's performance as a masterclass, with Yale's Akhil Amar, Katyal's mentor and constitutional giant, saying, "Neal channeled Madison ‚Äì brilliant reclamation of Article I," while critics, including treasury secretary Scott Bessent, slammed it as "foundational misunderstandings" of trade goals.Several business leaders were present in the packed courtroom with lines forming before proceedings opened. A ruling is expected in December or January. A Katyal win could void many 2025 tariffs, triggering refunds ‚Äì a "logistical nightmare" that conservative justice Amy Coney Barrett reflected on. Administration boffins have warned that even if the court rules against Trump they have a ‚Äúplan b‚Äù to impose tariffs.The IEEPA duties, dubbed "Liberation Day" tariffs, have netted the US Treasury more than $ 100 billion, but critics say it is costing the average American household $ 1200 per year in increased prices. President Trump has rejected the estimates and insists that prices of essential goods and groceries have actually come down.On Thursday, he pointed to WalMart lowering its packaged Thanksgiving dinner for ten by 25 percent (to $ 40) to make his point.
Article Summary: Neal katyal, the indian-american litigator leading the case for small businesses, delivered a forceful defence of congressional primacy. Chief justice john roberts zeroed in on ieepa's silence on "tariff," observing congress has spelled out such powers elsewhere.

Article Title: Kayla Nicole breaks her silence with a controversial post as Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce continue to ignore her
Article Text: Travis Kelce's ex, Kayla Nicole, faces online backlash amid rumors she's targeting his relationship with Taylor Swift. Nicole posted a cryptic message about 'humbly Black women,' while old comments about ethnicity resurfaced. A resurfaced video also shows her admitting to 'stalking' Kelce to reconcile.

Nicole posted a cryptic message about 'humbly black women,' while old comments about ethnicity resurfaced. A resurfaced video also shows her admitting to'stalking' kelce to reconcile.

Article Text:
What is Wordle and why is it everyone‚Äôs favourite daily word game



Decode the challenge: Smart strategies to solve Wordle in six moves



Objective: Guess the secret five-letter word within six attempts.

First move: Start with a word containing common vowels and consonants to reveal key letters early.

Enter guess: Type any valid five-letter word and submit it.

Review clues: Green shows the right letter in the right spot, yellow shows the right letter in the wrong spot, and grey means the letter isn‚Äôt in the word.

Strategy tip: Use feedback from each guess to narrow down possibilities.

Avoid mistakes: Skip letters that have already been ruled out.

Final aim: Solve the word within six guesses before running out of tries.

Wordle hints and clues for today‚Äôs puzzle



Starting letter: Today‚Äôs Wordle answer starts with the letter ‚ÄúG‚Äù.

Final hint: Someone hiding their true nature.

Vowels: The answer contains three vowels, increasing your chances if guessed correctly.

Guessing the correct vowels will likely help you find the 5-letter word quickly.

What is today‚Äôs Wordle answer?

Meaning of Guise





The New York Times‚Äô Wordle continues to be a global favourite among word enthusiasts. This guide provides clever hints, a clear solving breakdown, and the final answer for Wordle #1601, perfect for anyone seeking a nudge in the right direction. Each clue is designed to refine your guessing techniques, boost pattern recognition, and strengthen problem-solving abilities. Whether you‚Äôre a casual player or a dedicated Wordle fan, this guide will make every puzzle more engaging, insightful, and satisfying to solve. Get ready to sharpen your mind and enjoy the thrill of each daily challenge.Wordle is a daily word game that challenges players to uncover a hidden five-letter word in six tries. After each guess, colour-coded tiles provide feedback: green means the letter is correct and in the right position, yellow shows the letter is in the word but in the wrong spot, and grey indicates letters that aren‚Äôt in the word. With a new puzzle released every day, it has become a favourite daily ritual for word lovers across the globe.Having trouble with today‚Äôs Wordle? These 4 hints, covering starting letters and vowels, will guide you straight to the solution.The Wordle answer for #1601 on November 6, 2025, is: An outward appearance or form that often hides someone‚Äôs or something‚Äôs true nature.

Article Title: ‚ÄúMusk will get richer and a lot of people will get unemployed‚Ä¶‚Äù: Geoffrey Hinton warns on AI‚Äôs dark future
Article Text:
Source: Bloomberg

Geoffrey Hinton warns AI risks extend beyond technology



Elon Musk Becomes First Man To Have $500 Billion Wealth

Tech giants push AI growth, not safety



Automation and AI threaten employment



Potential benefits of AI



Need for regulation and careful planning in AI



Also Read |





Artificial intelligence (AI) is evolving rapidly, offering transformative possibilities across industries while simultaneously raising significant societal concerns. Geoffrey Hinton, widely known as the ‚ÄúGodfather of AI‚Äù and a Nobel Prize-winning expert in machine learning, has warned about the profound economic and ethical implications of this technology. Hinton cautions that, as AI adoption accelerates, tech billionaires like Elon Musk could see substantial financial gains, while millions of workers risk losing their jobs to automation. He emphasises that the challenges lie not only in the technology itself but in how society is structured, highlighting the urgent need to address the social and economic impact of AI alongside its technological development, urging global leaders to ensure fairness, transparency, and accountability in its integration.In an interview with Bloomberg Wall Street , Hinton has repeatedly highlighted that AI is not inherently harmful, but its unchecked development can lead to major societal disruption. He compares the potential dangers of AI to a ‚ÄúChernobyl moment,‚Äù referring to the 1986 nuclear disaster in Ukraine that released lethal radiation and caused massive casualties. For Hinton, this analogy illustrates how technological progress, if not properly regulated, can create sudden and devastating consequences for society.He warns that the risks of AI extend beyond the technology itself and are deeply connected to the structure of society. ‚ÄúThe reason it‚Äôs bad is because of the way society‚Äôs organised,‚Äù Hinton explained. ‚ÄúMusk will get richer, and a lot of people will get unemployed, and Musk won‚Äôt care. I‚Äôm using Musk as a stand-in. This isn‚Äôt an AI problem; it‚Äôs a societal organisation problem.‚ÄùOne of Hinton‚Äôs primary concerns is that the rapid development of AI is being driven by corporate greed rather than public interest or safety. Tech giants are investing heavily in AI infrastructure to gain a competitive edge, often prioritising profits over ethical considerations.The four major AI hyperscalers: Microsoft, Meta, Alphabet, and Amazon are projected to increase their combined capital expenditure from $360 billion this fiscal year to $420 billion next year. OpenAI alone has announced partnerships and infrastructure deals valued at $1 trillion with companies such as Nvidia, Broadcom, and Oracle. These figures highlight the immense financial stakes tied to AI, which Hinton believes incentivise job replacement over societal well-being.Hinton predicts that large-scale AI adoption will inevitably lead to widespread job losses. He argues that corporations cannot achieve maximum profit without replacing human labour with AI-driven systems. Recent evidence supports this concern. For example, job openings have dropped by approximately 30% since the launch of OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT, especially in entry-level positions.Amazon‚Äôs announcement of 14,000 layoffs, predominantly in middle management, further illustrates this trend. While CEO Andy Jassy attributed the decision to ‚Äúculture,‚Äù an internal memo predicted a leaner workforce as the company implements efficiency gains through extensive AI deployment. Hinton‚Äôs warnings suggest that this pattern of AI-driven unemployment is likely to accelerate as corporations continue investing in automation technologies.Despite the risks, Hinton acknowledges that AI has the potential to deliver significant societal benefits. In healthcare, AI can enhance diagnostic accuracy, accelerate drug discovery, and improve patient outcomes. In education, AI-driven platforms can personalise learning experiences and broaden access to quality instruction.Hinton stresses that the challenge lies in balancing these benefits against the risks of social inequality and mass unemployment. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a difficult decision because it can do tremendous good too,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIncreasing productivity in many industries should be beneficial, but society must manage these changes to prevent vast numbers of people from being left behind.‚ÄùWhen asked whether he would halt AI development altogether if possible, Hinton expressed uncertainty. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs not like nuclear weapons, which are only good for bad things,‚Äù he remarked. This highlights the complex ethical considerations surrounding AI: it is neither entirely harmful nor entirely beneficial. Policymakers, industry leaders, and society must navigate a delicate balance between innovation and safety.Hinton‚Äôs insights underscore the need for thoughtful regulation and societal planning to ensure that AI technologies enhance human well-being rather than exacerbate inequality and unemployment. The rise of AI presents both extraordinary opportunities and serious risks. While billionaires like Elon Musk may see unprecedented financial gains, millions of workers risk displacement.
Article Summary: Geoffrey hinton warns that the risks of ai extend beyond the technology itself and are deeply connected to the structure of society. He compares the potential dangers of ai to a ‚Äòchernobyl moment,‚Äô referring to the 1986 nuclear disaster in ukraine that released lethal radiation and caused massive casualties.

Article Title: India-US trade talks: Trump says discussions 'going good'; reiterates Russian oil claim
Article Text:
‚ÄòTrump‚Äôs Team In Serious Discussions With India‚Äô: White House As India-US Trade Talks Continue





US President Donald Trump on Thursday (local time) said that trade talks with India are ‚Äúgoing good‚Äù and signalled that he might visit the country next year.Addressing reporters at the White House, Trump again shifted focus to the issue of Moscow‚Äôs crude oil, stating, "They are going good, he stopped buying oil from Russia largely. He is a friend of mine, and we speak and he wants me to go there. ‚ÄùWhen further questioned about plans to travel to India in 2026, he added, "It could be, yes."Trump's tariffs are now facing a trial in the US Supreme Court, which he has been using as a key tool in both economic and diplomatic strategy. According to a Reuters report, the US Supreme Court justices on Wednesday appeared doubtful about the legality of his sweeping tariff approach a case that carries implications for global trade and represents a major test of Trump‚Äôs executive powers.Trump‚Äôs remarks come at a time when India and the United States are negotiating a Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA), which aims to scale up trade volumes from $191 billion to $500 billion by 2030. The ongoing talks have gained increased attention due to the 50% tariffs currently imposed by the United States on Indian goods.Earlier this week, Union commerce minister Piyush Goyal also provided an update on the negotiations, admitting that although progress is being made, key challenges remain.‚ÄúTalks are going on very well. There are many sensitive and serious issues, so naturally, it takes some time,‚Äù Goyal told ANI, when asked about the status of the ongoing trade discussions.His comments came after a similar update from the White House just hours earlier, which stated that the US President continues to prioritise strengthening ties with India and remains in regular contact with PM Modi, despite unresolved differences over tariffs and Russian oil imports.The White House update followed Trump‚Äôs recent acknowledgment of India‚Äôs reduced purchase of Russian oil. During his five-day Asia tour, he praised India for cutting back on Russian crude, describing the country as ‚Äúvery good‚Äù on the matter.Negotiations over the trade agreement have been active for months. Since March, five rounds of talks have taken place on the first phase of the deal, initially expected to be completed by the ‚Äúfall of 2025.‚Äù On October 23, both sides held virtual consultations. In mid-September, US officials, led by Brendan Lynch, Assistant US Trade Representative for South and Central Asia, met Indian officials in New Delhi, where both sides agreed to accelerate discussions.The bilateral trade agreement, formally introduced in February following leadership directives, is positioned as a key step towards expanding opportunities for both economies.Indian goods currently face a 50% tariff from the US. This includes a 25% base duty and a 25% additional tariff on top of that. The additional tariffs were announced by the US President accusing India of fueling Moscow‚Äôs war machine against Ukraine.
Article Summary: Us president donald trump on thursday said that trade talks with india are ‚Äúgoing good‚Äù and signalled that he might visit the country next year. Trump‚Äôs remarks come at a time when india and the united states are negotiating a bilateral trade agreement (bta) which aims to scale up trade volumes from $191 billion to $500 billion by 2030.

Article Title: Overriding Biden-era rules: US Supreme Court backs Trump admin's passport gender policy ‚Äî what it means
Article Text:
Donald Trump‚Äôs Trade Weapon Tested: US Supreme Court Weighs Limits of Emergency Powers, Authority

Sex markers on passports and changes to gender marker policies during Biden reign





What it means for transgender?









The Supreme Court on Thursday allowed US President Donald Trump‚Äôs administration to enforce a policy blocking transgender and nonbinary people from choosing passport sex markers that aligned with their gender identity.The decision, issued on the court‚Äôs emergency docket, permits the policy to remain in effect while a lawsuit over it proceeds.A lower-court order had required the government to continue letting applicants select male, female, or X on new or renewed passports to correspond with their gender identity. The Supreme Court‚Äôs three liberal justices dissented from the unsigned, conservative-majority order, AP news agency reported.‚ÄúDisplaying passport holders‚Äô sex at birth no more offends equal protection principles than displaying their country of birth,‚Äù the unsigned order stated. ‚ÄúIn both cases, the government is merely attesting to a historical fact without subjecting anyone to differential treatment.‚ÄùIn dissent, Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson said the policy made transgender people vulnerable to ‚Äúincreased violence, harassment, and discrimination‚Äù.She added, ‚ÄúThis court has once again paved the way for the immediate infliction of injury without adequate (or, really, any) justification,‚Äù and noted the policy derived directly from Trump‚Äôs executive order that described transgender identity as ‚Äúfalse‚Äù and ‚Äúcorrosive‚Äù.The Supreme Court majority held that preventing enforcement of the policy would harm the govt because passports fall within foreign affairs, a domain of executive-branch control. The dissenting justices countered that it was unclear how individual identification documents affected national foreign policy.The State Department altered its passport rules after Trump issued an executive order in January declaring the United States would ‚Äúrecognise two sexes, male and female‚Äù based on birth certificates and ‚Äúbiological classification‚Äù.Sex markers began appearing on passports in the mid-1970s and the federal govt started allowing them to be changed with medical documentation in the early 1990s, the plaintiffs said in court documents.A 2021 change under then-President Joe Biden, a Democrat, removed documentation requirements and allowed nonbinary people to choose an X gender marker after years of litigation.A judge blocked the Trump administration policy in June after a lawsuit from nonbinary and transgender people, some of whom said they were afraid to submit applications.An appeals court left the judge‚Äôs order in place. Solicitor General D John Sauer then turned to the Supreme Court, pointing to its recent ruling upholding a ban on transition-related healthcare for transgender minors and calling the Biden-era policy inaccurate.The plaintiffs, who challenged the policy, argue these passports are inaccurate and can be unsafe for those whose gender expression does not match the documents.‚ÄúForcing transgender people to carry passports that out them against their will increases the risk that they will face harassment and violence,‚Äù Jon Davidson, senior counsel for the ACLU‚Äôs LGBTQ and HIV Project, said.‚ÄúThis is a heartbreaking setback for the freedom of all people to be themselves, and fuel on the fire the Trump administration is stoking against transgender people and their constitutional rights.‚ÄùTransgender actor Hunter Schafer said in February that her new passport had been issued with a male gender marker, despite her having been marked female on her driver‚Äôs licence and previous passports.
Article Summary: Us president donald trump‚Äôs administration can enforce a policy blocking transgender and nonbinary people from choosing passport sex markers that aligned with their gender identity. A lower-court order had required the government to continue letting applicants select male, female, or x on new or renewed passports.

Article Title: Pelosi plans to retire in 2027 after spending 39 years in US Congress
Article Text:
FILE -- U.S. Rep. Nancy Pelosi (D-Calif.), the former Speaker of the House, addresses the Democratic National Convention in Chicago on Aug. 21, 2024. Pelosi announced on Nov. 6, 2025 that she will retire when her term concludes in early 2027, ending a remarkable career in which she rose to become one of the most powerful women in American history. (Jamie Kelter Davis/The New York Times)

Pelosi‚Äôs Viral ‚ÄòNo Kings‚Äô Crown-Smashing Act Triggers Uproar Across Political Circles





SAN FRANCISCO: Rep. Nancy Pelosi announced Thursday that she will retire when her term concludes in early 2027, ending a remarkable career in which she rose to become one of the most powerful women in American history.Pelosi, 85, was the nation's first and only female House speaker, and she will have represented San Francisco in Congress for 39 years when she leaves office. She has served during an era of seismic change for American society and her own city, from the throes of the AIDS crisis to the legalization of same-sex marriage, and through the meteoric rise of the tech sector and the nation's extreme polarization.She entered political office later in life and became a hero to Democrats for the way she wielded immense power to push the Affordable Care Act, climate change legislation and infrastructure programs through Congress."With a grateful heart, I look forward to my final year of service as your proud representative," she told her constituents in a nearly six-minute video posted on X early Thursday, with clips of San Francisco's iconic cable cars and colorful Victorian homes flashing in the background."My message to the city I love is this: San Francisco, know your power," she continued. "We have always led the way, and now we must continue to do so by remaining full participants in our democracy and fighting for the American ideals we hold dear."Pelosi, who likes to use the phrase "resting is rusting," led the House Democrats for 20 years, eight of which she spent as speaker. She has also been a prodigious fundraiser and raised more than $1.3 billion for Democratic campaigns, according to her aides.But she was reviled by conservatives, who painted her as the scary embodiment of liberal San Francisco values and blamed her for what they considered the nation's decline.She has been a chief irritant to President Donald Trump, even to this day, calling him "a vile creature" in a CNN interview that aired this week. She presided over two of his impeachment votes in the House. And he has called her "Crazy Nancy," with no sense of fondness for his foe.Her Democratic colleagues said she was unlike any other politician with whom they had worked. Jackie Speier, a Bay Area Democrat who served in the House for 15 years, said that Pelosi would go down in history "as the most consequential speaker ever.""She has a command, a presence. All eyes turn to her," Speier said.Her retirement had been grist for the local and national political rumor mill for several years, and younger Democrats grew increasingly eager to run for her seat. They feared, however, that it would be folly to challenge one of the most powerful politicians in modern history.Pelosi, for her part, told CNN days ago that she had no doubt she would win reelection if she were to run for another term.Still, the overwhelming defeat Democrats suffered last year in the congressional and presidential races has prompted soul-searching within the party -- and louder calls for older Democrats to step down and make way for new politicians with fresh ideas.The race to succeed Pelosi was already shaping up to be a fierce one before she announced her retirement. Scott Wiener, a Democratic state senator from San Francisco who is a champion of housing construction, and Saikat Chakrabarti, who worked as Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's chief of staff, have already announced they were running for the seat -- with or without Pelosi on the ballot.In recent months, Pelosi has refused to discuss her career plans, insisting she was focused solely on the passage of California's Proposition 50, a ballot measure to approve newly drawn House districts. She worked behind the scenes to help Gov. Gavin Newsom craft the measure, which passed Tuesday, and to raise money for the effort.It was considered one of her final achievements, both a blow to Trump, who had sought more Republican seats in the House by gerrymandering in conservative states, and a parting gift to the next generation of California Democrats who could benefit from as many as five additional seats in the state.Trump still has strong contempt for Pelosi."The retirement of Nancy Pelosi is a great thing for America," he said Thursday in a response to Fox News. "She was evil, corrupt and only focused on bad things for our country."At a packed union hall in San Francisco on Monday morning, Pelosi was the emcee for a Proposition 50 rally that included Newsom and labor leader Dolores Huerta."This is a moment of truth for America," Pelosi told the crowd. "It's self-defense for our democracy."In the audience, union workers wore T-shirts that Pelosi had autographed for them and pins with drawings of six tiny Nancy Pelosis standing side by side, each wearing a suit in a different color of the rainbow.At the rally, the ever-stylish Pelosi was sporting a green corduroy suit and green stilettos, never mind the fall she took in December on a marble staircase in Luxembourg that forced her to get a hip replacement and remain stuck for several months in dreaded flats.Pelosi's career in elected office has been a long one, but it did not span even half her life. Born into a politically powerful family of Democrats in Baltimore -- her father and brother each served as the city's mayor -- Pelosi went the more traditional route for women of her age.At first, anyway.She met her husband, Paul Pelosi, at Georgetown University, and the couple moved to his hometown, San Francisco, where she stayed home to raise their five children. During that time, Pelosi grew his career as a venture capitalist.As a young mother, Nancy Pelosi found a way to support the Democratic Party by opening up the family's large home for fundraisers. That led to friendships with a host of prominent San Francisco Democrats in the 1970s and 1980s, including Willie Brown, Jerry Brown and Phil and John Burton, brothers who served in Congress.Her connections and fundraising prowess helped her get elected as the first woman to chair the California Democratic Party.When Rep. Phil Burton died in office, his wife, Sala Burton, replaced him. Sala Burton was soon after diagnosed with cancer and told Pelosi she wanted her to run for the seat. Pelosi, who had shrugged off other suggestions to run for elected office, finally agreed.A special election was held in June 1987, and Pelosi, then 47, edged out Harry Britt, a gay socialist who had worked as an aide to Harvey Milk, the San Francisco supervisor who was assassinated at City Hall in 1978.Cleve Jones, who also worked for Milk and who created the AIDS Memorial Quilt, had backed Britt. Jones recalled in an interview that he initially had dismissed Pelosi as "a society lady.""I had the most wrong first impression of Nancy Pelosi," he said. "I just didn't take her very seriously."But he said his view changed when Pelosi used her first floor speech in the House to talk about the AIDS crisis as the Reagan administration largely ignored it. That same year, she helped Jones get his quilt installed on the National Mall in Washington.In 1990, she fought for the passage of an act named after Ryan White , a teenager who contracted HIV from a blood transfusion and was banned from his school after his diagnosis. The program paid for health care for HIV/AIDS patients who lacked medical coverage."She's just always been there," Jones said. "She's more than an ally. She's family."Barbara Boxer, who represented a different part of San Francisco in the House and later became a U.S. senator, said in an interview that she and Pelosi were constantly confused for each other and lumped together as "the two women from San Francisco."They bonded by sitting next to each other during countless flights home. Boxer praised her friend's unique combination of her social justice values, driven by her Catholic faith, and her tactical ability to know every facet of every bill and exactly where each member stood on it.Together, they persuaded the federal government to dump a plan to turn San Francisco's military base, the Presidio, into condominiums. Instead, the government preserved it as a national park.Karen Bass, the mayor of Los Angeles who served in Congress alongside Pelosi, said her colleague was a "masterful leader" who listened to widespread dissent in her caucus, but used her smarts and persuasion to repeatedly corral them and win key votes."I was in awe watching her," she said.Pelosi's rise -- and her wins on Capitol Hill -- made her a regular target for conservatives. During the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol, some rioters made a beeline for her office, tore down her wooden nameplate and broke into her chambers. One man, who was later prosecuted, was seen sitting in her chair with his feet propped up on her desk in a display of defiance.The next year, in October 2022, her husband was brutally attacked in the Pelosi home by a man living in the Bay Area who seemed obsessed with right-wing conspiracy theories.On Monday, however, Paul Pelosi was at the union hall with his wife, appearing healthy.At the Proposition 50 rally, Newsom thanked Nancy Pelosi for her work on the ballot measure."Some people go off and they talk about the way the world should be, but they don't do anything to damn manifest it," he said. "Nancy Pelosi doesn't go out to try to make points. She makes a difference."Pelosi stood behind him, beaming. Then, she exited the stage.
Article Summary: Pelosi, 85, was the nation's first and only female house speaker. She will have represented san francisco in congress for 39 years when she leaves office. She has served during an era of seismic change for american society and her own city. Gavin newsom craft the measure, which passed tuesday, and to raise money for the effort.

Article Title: US shutdown: America‚Äôs top 10 busiest airports face flight cuts; over 5,000 planes delayed
Article Text:
Mayhem At US Airports: Americans Suffer As FAA Orders 10% Flight Cuts Amid Govt Shutdown | Watch

According to data from the FAA and Airports Council International, these were the top 10 busiest US airports in 2024:

Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL)



Dallas Fort Worth International Airport (DFW)



Denver International Airport (DEN)

Chicago O‚ÄôHare International Airport (ORD)

Los Angeles International Airport (LAX)



John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK)

Charlotte Douglas International Airport (CLT)

Harry Reid International Airport (LAS)

Orlando International Airport (MCO)

Miami International Airport (MIA)





The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) announced that, beginning Friday, 40 of the busiest airports in the US will see a 10% reduction in flights, citing the ongoing strain on air traffic controllers amid the federal government shutdown.Although the FAA has yet to make an official public announcement, The New York Times on Thursday reported a list of airports expected to be affected, which includes the nation‚Äôs top 10 busiest hubs.The federal government shutdown has forced 13,000 air traffic controllers and 50,000 Transportation Security Administration (TSA) agents to work without pay. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said Wednesday the cuts could be reversed if Democrats agree to reopen the government.It is located about 10 miles south of the Downtown Atlanta district, was the busiest airport in the US last year with 108,067,766 total passengers ‚Äî a 3.3% increase from 2023. It recorded 52,511,402 passenger boardings ‚Äî aka enplanements ‚Äî a 3.06% increase year over year.This is located between Dallas and Fort Worth, Texas, served 87,817,864 total passengers in 2024, up 7.4% from the prior year. Enplanements reached 42,351,316, a 7.91% increase from 2023.The airport handled 82,358,744 passengers in 2024, marking a 5.8% increase from 2023.
